text: boulter: I think i know what the problem was. If the table ID is left to the user, in case they leave the field blank, the page will display an error. So by wrapping the whole for loop in an if statement will make sure that the loop runs only if the id is exists. if still shows an error with an invalid ID
It’sl like the image field in custom modules that comes by default wrapped in an if statement
i’m interested in testing the pages from hubdb id: 1657909
is there a way have certain elements in the HubDB tagged multiple ways so it show up in more than one filter?
here is the page I am working on: <http://www.decisivedata.net/work-database>
are you asking if you can do an OR query instead of an AND?
I’m asking how I would do it in the database
you could have multiple columns with select options, but you can’t say list projects where type is tableau OR size is large.
you could filter by projects that are large AND tableau though
could you have an item that was tagged both Tableau and PowerBi?
is there a way to do that?
Do you mean a multi-select column type? If so, not yet. You’d have to have different columns or have a string column delimited by something and use a contains operator to look for what you want.
Jonathan we've handled that by having comma separated 'tags' in a text field and queried on that field that it is contain
